Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle root; interior glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two horses to right (hind legs of both; tail and part of belly with added red of one); seat of near rider with added red; turn to handle attachment at extreme left.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 111, no. A182)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.054) (Phase 1)
